articles.author: Steven Scheer, Maya Gebeily, Parisa Hafezi
articles.description: Iran said early on Wednesday that its missile attack on Israel was finished barring further provocation, while Israel and the U.S. promised to retaliate against Tehran's escalation as fears of a wider war intensified.
articles.title: Iran says it has finished attack on Israel amid fears of spreading conflict

articles.author: Olena Harmash
articles.description: Ukraine can produce four million drones annually and is quickly ramping up its production of other weapons, President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said in comments authorised for publication on Wednesday.
articles.title: Ukraine ramps up arms production, can produce 4 million drones a year, Zelenskiy says

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli military strikes across the Gaza Strip killed at least 60 Palestinians overnight, including in a school sheltering displaced families, medics said, as Israeli tanks advanced in areas of Khan Younis in the south of the enclave.
articles.title: Israel kills dozens in Gaza, sends tanks into southern areas, medics say

articles.author: Steve Holland, Stephanie Kelly
articles.description: Democrat Tim Walz questioned Republican Donald Trump's fitness for office at the outset of Tuesday's vice presidential debate, arguing that the former president is too unstable to be trusted at a time of crisis in the Middle East.
articles.title: Walz, Vance clash on Middle East at start of US vice presidential debate

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian troops are in complete control of the town of Vuhledar in Ukraine's eastern Donetsk region, the SHOT Telegram channel and pro-Russian war bloggers said on Wednesday.
articles.title: Russian forces in complete control of Vuhledar in eastern Ukraine, war bloggers say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The idea of an Asian NATO floated by Japan's new prime minister is one to consider in the mid- to long-term but not imminent, the new foreign minister, Takeshi Iwaya, said on Wednesday.
articles.title: Japan's foreign minister says 'Asian NATO' is an idea for the future

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol held his first telephone call with Japan's new Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba on Wednesday and agreed a united response together with the United States is needed to counter North Korea's threats, his office said.
articles.title: South Korea's Yoon, Japan's Ishiba agree united response needed against North Korea

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Rising tensions in the Middle East have created air travel chaos, with global airlines diverting or cancelling flights on Wednesday and regional airports, including Lebanon, Israel and Kuwait, showing long delays, according to FlightRadar24 data.
articles.title: Diversions, disruptions: aviation grapples with Middle East escalation

articles.author: Michal Yaakov Itzhaki, Maayan Lubell
articles.description: On a Tel Aviv terrace at sunset, for a moment, everything seems so normal. A girl sets her colours and paper down next to mum's coffee cup and pulls up a chair. But mum only has a minute, she has to get back to saving her son, who is a hostage in Gaza.
articles.title: Israeli hostage mother fights for son's life

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israel's foreign minister said on Wednesday that he was barring U.N. Secretary General Antonio Guterres from entering the country for his failure to "unequivocally condemn" Iran's massive missile attack on Israel.
articles.title: Israel bars U.N. secretary general from entering country
